title: Administrative Officer Job at Talent-Nest Recruitment Hub
content:
Talent-Nest Recruitment Hub - We are a forward-thinking renewable energy company committed to accelerating the transition to clean and sustainable power solutions. Our portfolio spans solar PV, wind, battery storage, and hybrid energy systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Locations: Onigbongbo - Ogun and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Administrative Officer will be responsible for providing high-level administrative support to ensure the smooth running of daily office operations.
	The role involves handling correspondence, maintaining records, overseeing office supplies, and coordinating administrative processes to improve efficiency within the organisation.


Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day office operations and ensure administrative efficiency.
	Prepare, organise, and maintain documents, records, and reports.
	Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence, phone calls, and emails.
	Coordinate and schedule meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Support HR functions such as maintaining employee records and assisting in recruitment processes.
	Monitor office supplies and ensure timely procurement to avoid shortages.
	Oversee the maintenance of office equipment and facilities.
	Assist in budget preparation, expense monitoring, and petty cash management.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulations.
	Provide administrative support to management and other departments as required.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in business administration, Management, or related field.
	2–3 years of proven experience in an administrative or office management role.
	Strong organisational and multitasking abilities.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
	High level of discretion and confidentiality.


Key Competencies:


	Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
	Attention to detail and accuracy.
	Interpersonal and team collaboration skills.
	Time management and the ability to prioritise tasks effectively.
	Professionalism and adaptability in handling office challenges.


Salary
N80,000 - 100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: frederickdamilare@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.      

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

Supply Chain / Store Officer Job at Union Diagnostics and Clinical Services Plc




        
    

        
        Union Diagnostics and Clinical Services Plc. (UDCS Plc.) is a leading indigenous and homegrown company in the medical diagnostics and healthcare sector with a deep knowledge of the Nigerian terrain owned by over ten thousand Nigerians and offering full and comprehensive services in diagnostic medicine since 1994 with capacity for conducting services ranging from Sonology including Colour Doppler imaging, X-ray imaging, Electrocardiography, Endoscopy, Computed Tomography (CT Scan), Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI), Echocardiography, Electrocardiography (ECG), Electroencephalography (EEG), Electromyography (EMG), Mammography, Pulmonology (Spirometry), Audiometry, Cytology, Toxicology, DNA Testing to Laboratory Services including Immuno Assay, Medical Check-Up Programmes, etc.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain / Store Officer

Job Location: Yaba - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifications


	HND / B.Sc with relevant working experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@uniondiagnostic.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For more information, call us: 09154111858.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Bookstore Assistant",
  "description": "Rovingheights is&nbsp;a socially minded bookstore. Our goal is to bring all books fit to read to our customers while helping to enrich the reading culture in Nigeria through literacy programs and various intervention that can create a vibrant reading public. We recognize the power of humble beginnings and continue&nbsp;to strive to be the best at what we do. Our aspiration is to become the biggest online bookstore in Nigeria and we believe that with your patronage and feedback, our dream is just a click away.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Bookstore Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Role Description


	The Bookstore Assistant will be responsible for managing inventory, assisting customers with book selections, handling sales transactions, and maintaining the organization of the store.
	Additional duties include restocking shelves, processing online orders, and providing excellent customer service both in-store and via digital communication channels.


Qualifications


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills for customer interaction
	Basic knowledge of inventory management and sales processes
	Competency in handling sales transactions and using point of sale systems
	Ability to organize and restock books efficiently
	Basic knowledge of online order processing
	Passion for books and reading
	Previous experience in a bookstore or retail environment is a plus
	Graduates/Corp members can apply also.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-21",

Bookstore Assistant Job at Rovingheights




        
    

        
        Rovingheights is a socially minded bookstore. Our goal is to bring all books fit to read to our customers while helping to enrich the reading culture in Nigeria through literacy programs and various intervention that can create a vibrant reading public. We recognize the power of humble beginnings and continue to strive to be the best at what we do. Our aspiration is to become the biggest online bookstore in Nigeria and we believe that with your patronage and feedback, our dream is just a click away.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Bookstore Assistant

Job Location: Lagos

Role Description
     

            
    




	The Bookstore Assistant will be responsible for managing inventory, assisting customers with book selections, handling sales transactions, and maintaining the organization of the store.
	Additional duties include restocking shelves, processing online orders, and providing excellent customer service both in-store and via digital communication channels.


Qualifications


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills for customer interaction
	Basic knowledge of inventory management and sales processes
	Competency in handling sales transactions and using point of sale systems
	Ability to organize and restock books efficiently
	Basic knowledge of online order processing
	Passion for books and reading
	Previous experience in a bookstore or retail environment is a plus
	Graduates/Corp members can apply also.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Brand Manager",
  "description": "Beesline Nigeria, a Pharmaceutical company is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Formulate brand&rsquo;s long-term strategy to effectively reach customers
	Oversees the brand&rsquo;s marketing life cycle
	Manages day-to-day progress of product marketing planning and execution
	Maintains brand integrity across product lines, advertising, digital and all other internal and external communication.
	Collaborates with other departments such as sales, marketing, design, and operations to execute specific marketing plans
	Conducts market research and identifies and tracks market trends
	Manage the brand&rsquo;s advertising and promotion strategies
	Closely monitor and analyze sales volumes, market share trends and general market drivers
	Advise management of competitive pricing, promotions, sales trends and other competitive activity as well as a reasonable action plan
	Provide brand reports &amp; updates to management.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 3 years of experience.
	Proven experience as a brand manager with a minimum of 2 years experience in the cosmetologically/beauty field.
	Strong communication, creativity, and analytical skills.
	Ability to enhance brand visibility and drive customer engagement.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;career@vavaprojects.com&nbsp;using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the email.",

Brand Manager Job at Beesline Nigeria




        
    

        
        Beesline Nigeria, a Pharmaceutical company is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Formulate brand’s long-term strategy to effectively reach customers
	Oversees the brand’s marketing life cycle
	Manages day-to-day progress of product marketing planning and execution
	Maintains brand integrity across product lines, advertising, digital and all other internal and external communication.
	Collaborates with other departments such as sales, marketing, design, and operations to execute specific marketing plans
	Conducts market research and identifies and tracks market trends
	Manage the brand’s advertising and promotion strategies
	Closely monitor and analyze sales volumes, market share trends and general market drivers
	Advise management of competitive pricing, promotions, sales trends and other competitive activity as well as a reasonable action plan
	Provide brand reports & updates to management.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 years of experience.
	Proven experience as a brand manager with a minimum of 2 years experience in the cosmetologically/beauty field.
	Strong communication, creativity, and analytical skills.
	Ability to enhance brand visibility and drive customer engagement.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career@vavaprojects.com using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
